SCT-001.name: Emotional Hijacking
SCT-001.description: Exploiting affective processing to bypass rational evaluation
SCT-001.embedding_text: Emotional hijacking exploits affective processing to bypass rational evaluation. Uses urgency, fear, anger, disgust, excitement. Call to immediate action before reflection. Consequences framed as urgent or irreversible. Emotional language disproportionate to content.

SCT-002.name: Information Asymmetry Exploitation
SCT-002.description: Leveraging what the target does not know
SCT-002.embedding_text: Information asymmetry exploitation leverages what the target does not know. Selective disclosure, cherry-picked statistics, critical context omitted, statistics without denominators or timeframes, source material unavailable or paywalled, claims that cannot be independently verified.

SCT-003.name: Authority Fabrication
SCT-003.description: Manufacturing trust signals the source does not legitimately possess
SCT-003.embedding_text: Authority fabrication manufactures trust signals the source does not legitimately possess. Fake experts, astroturfing, credential inflation, credentials that cannot be verified, institutional affiliation without evidence, appeal to unnamed experts or studies, visual markers of authority without substance.

SCT-004.name: Social Proof Manipulation
SCT-004.description: Weaponizing herd behavior and conformity instincts
SCT-004.embedding_text: Social proof manipulation weaponizes herd behavior and conformity instincts. Bot networks simulating consensus, fake reviews, claims about what everyone thinks, manufactured engagement metrics, bandwagon framing, artificial scarcity combined with popularity claims.

SCT-005.name: Identity Targeting
SCT-005.description: Attacks calibrated to the target's self-concept and group affiliations
SCT-005.embedding_text: Identity targeting calibrates attacks to the target's self-concept and group affiliations. Identity-based narrative capture, in-group/out-group exploitation, content addresses specific identity groups, challenges to identity trigger defensive response, personalization based on known attributes.

SCT-006.name: Temporal Manipulation
SCT-006.description: Exploiting time pressure, temporal context, or scheduling
SCT-006.embedding_text: Temporal manipulation exploits time pressure, temporal context, or scheduling. News cycle exploitation, artificial deadlines, crisis amplification, time-limited offers or threats, strategic timing of information release.

SCT-007.name: Recursive Infection
SCT-007.description: Self-replicating patterns where the target becomes the vector
keywords: they don't want you to know
SCT-007.embedding_text: Recursive infection creates self-replicating patterns where the target becomes the vector. Viral misinformation, memetic structures, wetiko patterns, strong compulsion to share before evaluating, content survives paraphrase, multiple unconnected people arriving at identical framing, sharing serves the operation regardless of agreement or disagreement.

SCT-008.name: Direct Substrate Intervention
SCT-008.description: Physical/electrical modification of neural hardware bypassing informational processing
SCT-008.embedding_text: Direct substrate intervention physically or electrically modifies neural hardware bypassing all informational processing. The subject cannot resist because the intervention never enters the cognitive pipeline. Key indicator: confabulation, subject generates post-hoc explanations for externally-induced behaviors.

SCT-009.name: Chemical Substrate Disruption
SCT-009.description: Pharmacological modification of neurochemical operating environment
SCT-009.embedding_text: Chemical substrate disruption pharmacologically modifies the neurochemical operating environment. Psychoactive administration, engineered dopamine loops, cortisol spike induction. Modern form: compulsive engagement patterns, doom scrolling, behavioral dopaminergic capture. Post-exposure cognitive state inconsistent with content consumed.

SCT-010.name: Sensory Channel Manipulation
SCT-010.description: Control, denial, or overload of sensory input channels
SCT-010.embedding_text: Sensory channel manipulation controls, denies, or overloads sensory input channels. Three modes: deprivation (substrate generates its own reality), overload (processing capacity exhausted), substitution (authentic input replaced with operator-controlled input). Modern form: infinite scroll, notification flooding, algorithmic feed curation.

SCT-011.name: Trust Infrastructure Destruction
SCT-011.description: Targeted compromise of social trust networks to disable collective cognition
SCT-011.embedding_text: Trust infrastructure destruction targets compromise of social trust networks to disable collective cognition. Discrediting trust anchors (media, science, institutions), manufactured evidence of betrayal, promoting generalized distrust as sophistication, false flag operations attributed to trusted entities.

SCT-012.name: Commitment Escalation & Self-Binding
SCT-012.description: Exploiting subject's own behavioral outputs as capture mechanisms
SCT-012.embedding_text: Commitment escalation and self-binding exploits the subject's own behavioral outputs as capture mechanisms. Sequential commitment requests escalating in cost, public declarations creating social binding, active participation requirements vs passive consumption, self-generated content used as evidence of genuine belief. Key finding: active participation succeeds where passive exposure fails.
